entry.title: NCE & Sampled Softmax
entry.summary:
NCE

  • Dyer (2014) .. Note on why not neg sampling for all tasks
  • https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Candidate_Sampling

Sampled softmax

  • Jean et al. (2014) .. Sampled softmax for language translation
  • Bengio and Senecal (2008) .. Bengio paper applying importance sampling to NN
  • Kong (1992) : Math on importance sampling

  • Yoshua …
entry.content:
NCE

  • Dyer (2014) .. Note on why not neg sampling for all tasks
  • https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Candidate_Sampling

Sampled softmax

  • Jean et al. (2014) .. Sampled softmax for language translation
  • Bengio and Senecal (2008) .. Bengio paper applying importance sampling to NN
  • Kong (1992) : Math on importance sampling

References

  • Yoshua Bengio and Jean-Sébastien Senécal. Adaptive importance sampling to accelerate training of a neural probabilistic language model. IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks, 19(4):713–722, 2008. URL: www.iro.umontreal.ca/~lisa/publications2/index.php/attachments/single/177. ↩

  • Chris Dyer. Notes on noise contrastive estimation and negative sampling. CoRR, 2014. URL: http://arxiv.org/abs/1410.8251, arXiv:1410.8251. ↩

  • Sébastien Jean, Kyunghyun Cho, Roland Memisevic, and Yoshua Bengio. On using very large target vocabulary for neural machine translation. CoRR, 2014. URL: http://arxiv.org/abs/1412.2007, arXiv:1412.2007. ↩

  • Augustine Kong. A note on importance sampling using standardized weights. University of Chicago, Dept. of Statistics, Tech. Rep, 1992. URL: https://galton.uchicago.edu/techreports/tr348.pdf. ↩
